summary: The Protecting Children Act aims to strengthen protections for children in the workplace. It increases penalties for child labor violations under the Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) and the Occupational Safety and Health Act (OSH Act). The bill also establishes a National Advisory Committee on Child Labor, a Child Labor and Safety and Health Fund, and enhances research and data collection on child labor and workplace safety for young workers. It also updates standards, improves the process for reviewing and enforcing regulations, and expands public education and training initiatives.
